alert.note: Alert for Boone; Montgomery (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 24 at 11:27PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hendricks, western Boone and southern Montgomery Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1127 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Crawfordsville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Hendricks, western Boone and southern Montgomery Counties, including the following locations... Jamestown, Advance, Thorntown, New Ross, Lizton, New Market, Darlington and Ladoga. This includes Interstate 74 between mile markers 35 and 58. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
